30 30

Celebrating 30 Years of AIDS Vancouver

The 30 30 campaign was created in 2013 to celebrate AIDS Vancouver’s 30th anniversary. The campaign pieces together the dynamic history of HIV in Vancouver, told by and for those who where there.

1989

1990

A tristique penatibus urna ridiculus placerat dapibus.

In 1990

  • Nelson Mandela is released from Prison after 27 years behind bars. LINK
  • The World Health Organization removes homosexuality from its list of Mental Illnesses. LINK
  • Berners-Lee who in 1990 developed a system of online links called Hypertext Transfer Protocol (or HTTP) LINK

Local

  • Dr. Peter Jepson-Young starts a two year video diary series to educate Canadian about living with HIV. LINK
  • Gay Games Held in Vancouver. LINK
  • New Vancouver Program For Gay Men 'AIDS Vancouver has alunched a new program of education and information for gay men.' Guide Magazine, Seattle Dec. 90 pg.11

Statistics

  • 982 HIV/AIDS Deaths in Canada. LINK
  • 8 million HIV cases globally. LINK
  • 5,500,500 estimated HIV cases in Africa and more than 650,000 estimated AIDS cases. LINK

Global

  • Ryan White dies and President Bush signs Ryan White Act. LINK
  • 6th IAS Conference in San Francisco. Protestors boycott the US immigration policy. LINK
  • First National Conference on Women and AIDS, Boston. LINK
  • Act Up demands clinical trials incorporate women and people of color. LINK
  • The AIDS ward at Cook County Hospital in Chicago, refuses to treat women. LINK

National

  • National AIDS Strategy announced (Canada). LINK
  • Canadian HIV Trials Network started. LINK
  • CAHR founded; sponsored by St. Paul's and UBC. LINK
  • CATIE, Canada’s source for HIV and Hepatitis Information, is formed. LINK
1991

AIDS Vancouver - Prevent. Act. Support.

AIDS Vancouver plays a special role in providing quality health care to people affected by HIV/AIDS living in the Lower Mainland. It is clearly more than just a community health care organization. It is an organization whose presence and continued strength is essential to the quality for life of this community and of each individual and family who draws on its services. Our Agency is a vital community asset which everyone affected by HIV/AIDS can share, and in which we all have a stake.

Visit us at aidsvancouver.org

2013 © AIDS Vancouver
